page.title: 10Blakesley;A General Reveiw.
page.content: The countryside of this area is pleasant farmland with gentle rolling arable land but black and white cows are still to be seen. In the centre of the area are the villages of Blakesley and Wood-End which are comprised largely of warm brown ironstone houses many dating back to the 17th Century. There has been a small amount of development which has blended in well with the local architecture and at the present time the population is about 600.The village kept a rural identity in spite of limited development and the fact that the majority of residents work outside the area.A visitor could well believe that time has stood still as the streets are quiet and peaceful.
